main event: Radar detected an unidentified flying object near Marlin, Texas for 2 1/2 minutes in 1952.
interesting points: The object was observed on radar but not visually by the observers.
The object disappeared from the radar scope after 2 1/2 minutes.
The report states the object was likely a wind-borne object and not of military interest, but there was insufficient data to make a reliable conclusion.
Subsequent checks revealed no known air traffic or balloon releases in the area at the time of the sighting.
A helicopter flight was conducted at night to search the area, but no unusual objects or crashed aircraft were found.
